title: Scottish Programme of Advanced Training in Social Anthropology
abstractText:
This programme involves a series of innovative advanced training courses for social anthropology postgraduates, postdoctoral fellows and early career researchers in Scotland, designed to address issues of capacity-building, international collaboration, links between academic and non-academic practice, and the building of research careers. These short, intensive residential courses will augment existing subject-specific training for research students in social anthropology, at both introductory and advanced levels.

The courses will contribute to the development of a consortium approach to postgraduate training in Scotland. Introductory students will be trained in innovative methods of field research, while advanced students and early career researchers will have the opportunity to relate their own work to cutting-edge thinking in the discipline, as represented in the work of its foremost international scholars, while also working with academic and non-academic practitioners on key areas of career development.
